verses.kjv: O LORD, thou hast searched me, and known me.
verses.ct: LORD, you have examined me thoroughly and you know me completely.

verses.kjv: Thou knowest my downsitting and mine uprising, thou understandest my thought afar off.
verses.ct: You know when I sit down and when I stand up; you understand my thoughts from far away.

verses.kjv: Thou compassest my path and my lying down, and art acquainted with all my ways.
verses.ct: You observe my travels and my rest, and you are familiar with everything I do.

verses.kjv: For there is not a word in my tongue, but, lo, O LORD, thou knowest it altogether.
verses.ct: Before a word even reaches my tongue, you already know it entirely, LORD.

verses.kjv: Thou hast beset me behind and before, and laid thine hand upon me.
verses.ct: You surround me from behind and in front, and you have placed your hand on me.

verses.kjv: Such knowledge is too wonderful for me; it is high, I cannot attain unto it.
verses.ct: This kind of knowledge is too amazing for me — it is beyond my reach, and I cannot grasp it.

verses.kjv: Whither shall I go from thy spirit? or whither shall I flee from thy presence?
verses.ct: Where could I go to escape your spirit? Where could I run to get away from your presence?

verses.kjv: If I ascend up into heaven, thou art there: if I make my bed in hell, behold, thou art there.
verses.ct: If I go up to heaven, you are there. If I make my bed in the depths of the grave, you are there too.

verses.kjv: If I take the wings of the morning, and dwell in the uttermost parts of the sea;
verses.ct: If I could ride on the wings of the dawn and settle at the farthest edge of the sea,

verses.kjv: Even there shall thy hand lead me, and thy right hand shall hold me.
verses.ct: even there your hand would guide me, and your right hand would hold on to me.

verses.kjv: If I say, Surely the darkness shall cover me; even the night shall be light about me.
verses.ct: If I say, 'Surely the darkness will hide me,' then the night would become light around me.

verses.kjv: Yea, the darkness hideth not from thee; but the night shineth as the day: the darkness and the light are both alike to thee.
verses.ct: Even darkness is not dark to you; the night shines like the day — darkness and light are the same to you.

verses.kjv: For thou hast possessed my reins: thou hast covered me in my mother’s womb.
verses.ct: You formed my innermost being; you wove me together in my mother's womb.

verses.kjv: I will praise thee; for I am fearfully and wonderfully made: marvellous are thy works; and that my soul knoweth right well.
verses.ct: I praise you because I am remarkably and wonderfully made. Your works are marvelous, and my soul knows this very well.

verses.kjv: My substance was not hid from thee, when I was made in secret, and curiously wrought in the lowest parts of the earth.
verses.ct: My frame was not hidden from you when I was shaped in secret, intricately crafted in the depths of the earth.

verses.kjv: Thine eyes did see my substance, yet being unperfect; and in thy book all my members were written, which in continuance were fashioned, when as yet there was none of them.
verses.ct: Your eyes saw me when I was still unformed. Every one of my days was recorded in your book and planned out before a single one of them existed.

verses.kjv: How precious also are thy thoughts unto me, O God! how great is the sum of them!
verses.ct: How precious your thoughts are to me, God! How vast is the total of them!

verses.kjv: If I should count them, they are more in number than the sand: when I awake, I am still with thee.
verses.ct: If I tried to count them, they would outnumber the grains of sand. When I wake up, I am still in your presence.

verses.kjv: Surely thou wilt slay the wicked, O God: depart from me therefore, ye bloody men.
verses.ct: God, if only you would destroy the wicked! Get away from me, you violent people!

verses.kjv: For they speak against thee wickedly, and thine enemies take thy name in vain.
verses.ct: They speak against you with evil intent, and your enemies misuse your name.

verses.kjv: Do not I hate them, O LORD, that hate thee? and am not I grieved with those that rise up against thee?
verses.ct: LORD, don't I despise those who hate you? Am I not disgusted by those who rebel against you?

verses.kjv: I hate them with perfect hatred: I count them mine enemies.
verses.ct: I despise them with absolute hatred; I consider them my own enemies.

verses.kjv: Search me, O God, and know my heart: try me, and know my thoughts:
verses.ct: Examine me, God, and know my heart. Test me and know my anxious thoughts.

verses.kjv: And see if there be any wicked way in me, and lead me in the way everlasting.
verses.ct: See if there is any offensive path in me, and lead me along the everlasting way.
